Specific Details: The role of micro-generation of renewable energy, and solar PV in particular, in meeting Ireland climate action obligations; the policy and regulatory framework for the micro-generation sector; the restrictive nature of the planning code as it pertains to roof mounted solar PV installations; the need for further policy supports to incentivise the wider adoption micro-generation installations by business.
DPOs Lobbied: Brian Stanley|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Pat Deering|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The role of micro-generation of renewable energy, and solar PV in particular, in meeting Ireland climate action obligations; the policy and regulatory framework for the micro-generation sector; the restrictive nature of the planning code as it pertains to roof mounted solar PV installations; the need for further policy supports to incentivise the wider adoption micro-generation installations by business.
Intended Results: A more positive and supportive regulatory framework for the micro-generation sector and the wider adoption of micro-generation and energy storage in meeting Ireland's climate action obligations.
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Jim Devlin and Pat Smith (Chairman of the Micro Renewable Energy Federation
Client(s): Micro Renewable Energy Federation Limited|Suite 109, The Capel Building, Mary's Abbey, Dubin 7|jim@cunninghamdevlin.ie|087 2631057

Specific Details: Climate Emergency Measures Bill
DPOs Lobbied: Róisín Shorthall|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Thomas Pringle|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Catherine Murphy|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Brian Stanley|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Seán Sherlock|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Climate Emergency Measures Bill
Intended Results: Progression of the Climate Emergency Measures Bill & political support to end fossil fuel exploration
Lobbying Activities: Invitation to a number of TDs asking them to speak at a public meeting on progression of the Climate Emergency Measures Bill in Buswells Hotel, June 11th.|Email|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Catherine Devitt, Head of Policy, Stop Climate Chaos coalition
Grassroots directive: We sent an email to our supporters on May 29th, urging them to email or call their TDs to tell him to stand up for climate action by calling for a ban on issuing of licenses for fossil fuel exploration.  We sent an email to our supporters on July 10th asking them to email their TDs to commit to introducing or supporting legislation in the next Dáil to end new exploration for fossil fuels. On June 7th, we emailed our supporters asking them to attend a Dail rally on the Climate Emergency Measures Bill and a public meeting on next steps for the Bill.

Lobbyist Name: SIPTU - Services Industrial Professional Trade Union
Specific Details: 'Email and formal letter to Mr Brian Stanley TD, follow up telephone conversation regarding the employment situation of SIPTU members working in Steris AST, IDA Business & Technology Park, Sragh Road, Tullamore, County Offaly.  Labour Court recommendation LCR21718 recommended that the Employer recognise SIPTU as the representative for employees who are in membership of the Union on employment related matters. The Employer has received state aid from the IDA. '
Subject Matter: 'Email and formal letter to Mr Brian Stanley TD, follow up telephone conversation regarding the employment situation of SIPTU members working in Steris AST, IDA Business & Technology Park, Sragh Road, Tullamore, County Offaly.  Labour Court recommendation LCR21718 recommended that the Employer recognise SIPTU as the representative for employees who are in membership of the Union on employment related matters. The Employer has received state aid from the IDA. '
Intended Results: That the employment issue effecting SIPTU members of an Employer, Steris AST be raised with the Táiniste & Minister for Enterprise, Trade & Employment Mr Leo Varadker. The issue being that the Employer, Steris AST are in receipt of $678,000 in capital from the state agency, the IDA while the Employer was unwilling to attend a hearing of a state agency, The Labour Court or abide by its recommendation.

Intended Results: NHI was requesting to Deputy Stanley as the Chair of the Public Accounts Committee that he is aware of the importance of the recommendations being implemented and the Committee is informed regarding progress in such regard. The Committee’s examination of a scheme that appropriates approximately €1 billion of health spending per annum is a very important undertaking.
